title: Remove 'Description' since it's unused.
body:
We only use one field from it, so there is no point in this structure.

Also, it's not a public type.

title: Add a FontTransform to allow arbitrary transformations on glyphs.
body: Fixes #34

title: Properly support the offset in dwrite and freetype loaders.
body:
This change makes the positioning of in the canvas consistent between the
loaders on all platforms. It adopts the convention of having the origin at the
top left with +y going down. Glyphs with their baseline at the specified
offset. This follows the convention of cairo and HTML canvas.

The version is bumped because of this behaviour change.

title: Upgrade to 2018 edition and reduce unnecessary dependencies
body: This avoids building the `dirs` crate on Windows where it is unused.

title: Support blits with an offset
body:
This will be used to implement proper origin support in the freetype and
directwrite loaders. Currently those loaders either ignore the origin
or only use the fractional part.

title: [WIP] Fix select_family_by_name in fontconfig loader.
body: Closes #55, Closes #63

title: Use rustfmt.
body: This is a pretty big change, but it will help us later.

title: Use Impact as a default fantasy font on Windows.
body:
According to https://www.w3.org/Style/Examples/007/fonts.en.html

Closes #58

title: Added Source::all_fonts.
body: This made the `list-fonts` example times faster.

title: Flip CoreGraphics origin in the y axis (issue #43)
body: I believe this fixes [#43](https://github.com/pcwalton/font-kit/issues/43). I've tested this with Raqote and ran font-kit's tests. It appears to work correctly with this subtraction.

title: Check results in Loader::glyph_for_char.
body:
Previously, `glyph_for_char` in CoreText and FreeType loaders were always
returned `Some`, instead of checking results.

Closes #38

title: Fontconfig rewrite.
body: Moved all unsafe code into a safe, idiomatic submodule. This should make life easier.

title: Return a whole list of families in fontconfig.
body:
Fixes #42.

`FcFontMatch` only returns the best matching font, but we need to return a whole list (so that, for example, querying `sans-serif` returns all of the variants of DejaVu Sans, and not just the regular one). I'm not actually sure that `FcFontSort` is the right function (as opposed to `FcFontList`), but it's the one that `fc-match` uses.

title: Add prototype fallback API for DirectWrite
body:
Note: this version will fail to compile unless the dwrote dep is manually patched to git master, as a release hasn't been done with https://github.com/servo/dwrote-rs/pull/32

An additional concern is performance, as the font data will need to be copied each time a fallback font is used.

Addresses #37

title: Add syntax highlighting to README snippet
body: Also formatted with rustfmt.

title: Resolve default fonts using fontconfig.
body:
Uses the same algorithm as [fc-match](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/fontconfig/fontconfig/blob/master/fc-match/fc-match.c).

Partially fixes #25

title: implement glyph_by_name method
body:
This change implements looking up glyphs by their name, which is useful when dealing with fonts that may not have a cmap (in my case certain CFF files).

Implementing this outside fontkit, although possible, is quite cumbersome as I basically need to mirror all the platform-specific dependencies and compilation flags.

There's two rough edges at the moment that I'm happy to try and fix up if you're generally interested in this change. One being the FFI binding for `CTFontGetGlyphWithName` that should probably move into the `core-text` crate, and the other that there appears to be no simple way to do name-based lookup using the DirectWrite APIs.

Let me know what you think!

title: Implement BlitA8ToRgb24
body: Fixes #16

title: add error impls for error types
body: self-explanatory. allows anyone to use the error as a trait object if that benefits them

title: Implement the origin method on DirectWrite
body: I don't know much about fonts so these values were basically experimentally determined, but they seem to work in Alacritty.

title: Fix DirectWrite raster bounds
body: Fixes #15

title: Reset character size after rasterizing on FreeType
body: Fixes #14

title: fix type mismatch (issue #8).
body: Closes #8

title: Fix Windows build
body: This fixes the issue with Windows not building because of a bad version of dwrote-rs (breaking changes in patch update).

title: Remove unnecessary dependencies
body:
- `arrayvec` isn't used at all, it's just a baggage dependency
- `failure` is only used for implementing `Display` and for saving 20 lines, you import all of these dependencies:
```
├── failure v0.1.2
│   ├── backtrace v0.3.9
│   │   ├── cfg-if v0.1.5
│   │   ├── rustc-demangle v0.1.9
│   │   └── winapi v0.3.6 (*)
│   └── failure_derive v0.1.2
│       ├── proc-macro2 v0.4.19 (*)
│       ├── quote v0.6.8 (*)
│       ├── syn v0.14.9
│       │   ├── proc-macro2 v0.4.19 (*)
│       │   ├── quote v0.6.8 (*)
│       │   └── unicode-xid v0.1.0 (*)
│       └── synstructure v0.9.0
│           ├── proc-macro2 v0.4.19 (*)
│           ├── quote v0.6.8 (*)
│           ├── syn v0.14.9 (*)
│           └── unicode-xid v0.1.0 (*)
```
If that's worth it... well, I don't know. You decide.
- In the future, `dwrote-rs` currently depends on serde (which should be optional, as `pathfinder` doesn't use any serde features, so it's just a baggage dependency). A future PR should remove that dependency, too (serde is pretty large).

This PR brings the dependency count from 44 to 38, removing 6 dependencies with no features removed or API changed.
